content:
• Friday, June 1, 2012
  • WBA

    Walgreens (WAG) and Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) agree to dismiss their dispute filed in...

    Walgreens (WAG) and Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) agree to dismiss their dispute filed in September 2011. WAG issued the following statement: "The parties have agreed to dismiss their respective claims, and no other action has been or will be taken by either party with respect to this case. These dismissals have no impact on the parties' ability or inability to come to terms on a pharmacy agreement." WAG -1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK -16.3%) becomes the latest casualty of the recent selloff in richly-priced tech...

    Splunk (SPLK -16.3%) becomes the latest casualty of the recent selloff in richly-priced tech names. Shares end the day near their post-IPO lows after an FQ1 beat and above-consensus FY13 revenue guidance fail to satisfy investors who gave the company sky-high multiples. Barclays' Raimo Lenschow, who launched coverage 10 days ago, is reiterating an Overweight, and is pleased with the company's deferred revenue growth, sales force expansion, and large deal volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • DYN

    Dynegy (DYN +11.4%) wins a U.S. bankruptcy judge's approval of a settlement with creditors,...

    Dynegy (DYN +11.4%) wins a U.S. bankruptcy judge's approval of a settlement with creditors, bringing the power producer's Dynegy Holdings unit closer to emerging from Chapter 11 protection. DYN says creditors who joined the settlement hold more than $2.7B of claims against Dynegy Holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • PXD

    Barron's "two defensive picks" in energy exploration are getting pummeled along with other...

    Barron's "two defensive picks" in energy exploration are getting pummeled along with other energy issues as crude oil caps an 8.4% loss on the week. Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD -8.9%) and Energen (EGN -3.2%) have "extensive hedge protection through 2014" that provides resiliency to their capital program, which should protect growth expectations during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +8%) pops after Ascendiant Capital initiated the shares...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +8%) pops after Ascendiant Capital initiated the shares earlier today with a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Reuters reports negotiations have broken off in Dell's (DELL-OLD -1.9%) attempt to buy Quest...

    Reuters reports negotiations have broken off in Dell's (DELL-OLD -1.9%) attempt to buy Quest Software (QSFT -5.2%). A week ago, Dell was said to be on the verge of a deal for QSFT at a price of $23-$26.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • BTU

    If coal stocks (KOL -1.2%) have finally hit bottom, Paul Ausick seems to like Peabody's (BTU...

    If coal stocks (KOL -1.2%) have finally hit bottom, Paul Ausick seems to like Peabody's (BTU -0.8%) prospects best, citing its Australian mines that provide a key Asian outlet. Separately, Patriot Coal (PCX +2.9%) is far outperforming peers on chatter the company paid its coupon on convertible debt. Also: CNX +1.3%, ANR +0.4%, ACI -1.7%, JRCC -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 11 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake's (CHK -6.7%) new discovery in the Anadarko Basin isn't helping shares, as the price...

    Chesapeake's (CHK -6.7%) new discovery in the Anadarko Basin isn't helping shares, as the price of crude sinks. CEO Aubrey McClendon says the discovery underscores a focus on getting growth from existing assets “rather than on pursuing new leasehold." CHK plans to drill ~65 wells in Anadarko; the drilling is already factored into its capital spending plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • KSS

    Kohl's (KSS 2.7%) continues its slide, pushed lower again today by a KSS <font color="...

    Kohl's (KSS 2.7%) continues its slide, pushed lower again today by a KSS <font color=" target="_blank">downgrade to Neutral at Atlantic Equities. The firm cites increased comp pressure from aggressive competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM

  • Gold continues to soar, nearly erasing on June 1 all of its losses from May (the worst May in 30...

    Gold continues to soar, nearly erasing on June 1 all of its losses from May (the worst May in 30 years). The yellow metal is up 4.2% to $1,630/oz. Oil can't catch a bid, its drastic May fall accelerating as June begins. WTI crude -4.3% to $82.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 7 Comments
  • CONN

    Shares of Conn's (CONN +0.1%) poke out a tiny gain with a little help from an initiation from...

    Shares of Conn's (CONN +0.1%) poke out a tiny gain with a little help from an initiation from analysts at Piper Jaffray at Overweight. The firm has a take that Conn's is mischaracterized as an electronics retailer, when actually high-margin furniture and mattresses are part of the big picture.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • TRX

    Tanzanian Royalty Exploration (TRX +2.3%) reports positive assay results from the Buckreef...

    Tanzanian Royalty Exploration (TRX +2.3%) reports positive assay results from the Buckreef Project in Tanzania's Lake Victoria Goldfields. TRX says its deep drilling program has provided the first opportunity to sample the deep mineralization at Buckreef and confirmed the width and grade of gold mineralization at depth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • REGN

    Cowen's Phil Nadeau says that its latest physician survey suggests sales of Regeneron's (REGN...

    Cowen's Phil Nadeau says that its latest physician survey suggests sales of Regeneron's (REGN 8.9%) big revenue driver, Eylea, may be slowing. Measuring the uptake of the company's treatment for a leading cause of blindness in the elderly, the number of patients on the drug grew 22% from March to May, compared to 155% growth from January to March. Based on this level of deceleration, Cowen thinks the stock may be rich at these levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -6.4%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.9%) have had a very rough week, as concerns...

    Seagate (STX -6.4%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.9%) have had a very rough week, as concerns about weakening PC demand and the end of a favorable supply/pricing climate for hard drives (the result of Thai manufacturing disruptions) take their toll. Also, yesterday, Barclays aired concerns about the impact of solid-state drives (boosted by upcoming MacBook releases) and tablet cannibalization on hard drive demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 4 Comments
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI -2.7%) gives up the day's early gains following its earnings beat. Despite the...

    SAIC (SAI -2.7%) gives up the day's early gains following its earnings beat. Despite the weakness, Cowen says its Q1 was strong, and the jump in bookings warrants an upgrade to Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • SYNC

    More on the Synacor downgrades: While positive on the company's prospects, Citi and BofA note...

    More on the Synacor downgrades: While positive on the company's prospects, Citi and BofA note Synacor's (SYNC -16.9%) recent run-up has much to do with the promotional efforts of the infamous Jonathan Lebed. Stifel, meanwhile, argues Synacor deserves a valuation on par with digital advertising names, rather than more highly-priced cloud software firms. Also, Albert Fried is starting coverage with an Underperform, and points out Synacor's share lockup expires in mid-July.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • TG

    Tredegar (TG +6.3%) pops on an upgrade to Buy from Neutral on valuation at Davenport.

    Tredegar (TG +6.3%) pops on an upgrade to Buy from Neutral on valuation at Davenport.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • GM

    Shares of GM shoot straight up after the company announces a detailed plan to lowers its pension...

    Shares of GM shoot straight up after the company announces a detailed plan to lowers its pension obligations with buyout offers. After sitting down as much as 1% earlier today, shares are now up 3.3% off the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • HTZ

    Shares of Hertz Global (HTZ -7.5%) and Avis Budget (CAR -8.4%) both fall harder than Dollar...

    Shares of Hertz Global (HTZ -7.5%) and Avis Budget (CAR -8.4%) both fall harder than Dollar Thrifty (DTG -2.2%) as the dance between the three car rental companies continues. The prevailing thought is that if Hertz doesn't snap up Dollar Thrifty fairly quickly, it risks Avis coming back in to bid. But tricky part for the company is that it has to divest assets, appease DTG shareholders, and deal with the FTC to get a buyout done.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • DPZ

    Shares of Domino's Pizza (DPZ -4.5%) fall off after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a...

    Shares of Domino's Pizza (DPZ -4.5%) fall off after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a Neutral rating and raises concerns on the company's ability to grow sales domestically.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN -2%) slips on reports of a negative article in TheStreetSweeper this morning....

    Medivation (MDVN -2%) slips on reports of a negative article in TheStreetSweeper this morning. The report says the stock's high valuation fails to take into account smaller-than-anticipated sales and a limited market, heavy competition and a poor working environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • PHM

    Homebuilder stocks (XHB -4.8%) are crushed in the wake of today's jobs report: PHM -10.4%, LEN...

    Homebuilder stocks (XHB -4.8%) are crushed in the wake of today's jobs report: PHM -10.4%, LEN -7.4%, DHI -8.5%, TOL -6.1%, KBH -5.5%. Fannie Mae's Doug Duncan recalls the spring-to-summer slowdown pattern of each of the last two years: "If this pattern recurs, we expect that hopes for a meaningful housing recovery will be delayed once again."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • BMY

    Amylin's (AMLN -1.5%) buyout price could be below current levels, says Rodman & Renshaw,...

    Amylin's (AMLN -1.5%) buyout price could be below current levels, says Rodman & Renshaw, noting that at the stocks current valuation investors are exposed to more downside risk than upside potential. The firm reiterates its Underperform rating on the stock with a $22 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • IP

    International Paper (IP -2.8%) says it will sell three U.S. containerboard mills valued at a...

    International Paper (IP -2.8%) says it will sell three U.S. containerboard mills valued at a combined $470M in sales mandated by the Justice Department as a condition for IP's acquisition of Temple-Inland. In reiterating its Buy rating, Deutsche Bank says the $470M figure is considerably better than its expectations of $300-$450M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (SYNC -15%) gets hit by a trio of valuation downgrades earlier today: Stifel Nicolaus...

    Synacor (SYNC -15%) gets hit by a trio of valuation downgrades earlier today: Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Hold, Citi lowers it to Neutral and BofA Merrill Lynch to Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -5.9%) has given back all of the gains seen in late trading yesterday. While Baird...

    Facebook (FB -5.9%) has given back all of the gains seen in late trading yesterday. While Baird has issued a bullish report, the NYT has a less-than-glowing column about Facebook's Sponsored Stories product, noting its spotty ad-matching capabilities and privacy issues. Meanwhile, the L.A. Times reports on how some U.S. teens are souring on Facebook relative to Twitter and Tumblr, due to privacy concerns. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • KFRC

    Shares of staffing companies slump after the jobs report highlights a weaker-than-expected...

    Shares of staffing companies slump after the jobs report highlights a weaker-than-expected market. Decliners: HSON -5.8%, KFRC -3.8%, MAN -2.8%, RHI -3.9%, ASGN -4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • SNN

    U.K. medical device maker Smith & Nephew (SNN -3.2%) slips after saying it's withdrawing the...

    U.K. medical device maker Smith & Nephew (SNN -3.2%) slips after saying it's withdrawing the optional metal liner component used in its hip implants, saying it isn't satisfied with clinical results. Approximately 7,700 metal liners have been implanted since the component was introduced in 2007, the majority of which have been used in stemmed total hip replacements.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • TM

    Shares of Toyota (TM -2.3%) take a turn south after a downgrade from Credit Suisse takes...

    Shares of Toyota (TM -2.3%) take a turn south after a downgrade from Credit Suisse takes precedent with investors over the automaker's 87.% rise in May sales over a soft earthquake-influenced comparable.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -8.9%) is diving to new post-IPO lows on share lockup expiration day. The decline...

    Groupon (GRPN -8.9%) is diving to new post-IPO lows on share lockup expiration day. The decline adds to the sizable losses Groupon saw yesterday ahead of the expiration, which allows ~600M shares held by insiders to be sold for the first time. It was less than 3 weeks ago that Groupon staged a massive pre- and post-earnings rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • ALT

    PharmAthene (PIP +37%) soars today, after a U.S. court upheld a ruling awarding it a portion of...

    PharmAthene (PIP +37%) soars today, after a U.S. court upheld a ruling awarding it a portion of profits received by Siga Technologies (SIGA -2.6%) from its smallpox antiviral drug, ST-246. The decision is just the latest development in what has turned out to be a long-running legal battle between the two companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BP

    Is BP’s (BP +1.5%) announcement that it may sell its share of TNK-BP a sign it's raising...

    Is BP’s (BP +1.5%) announcement that it may sell its share of TNK-BP a sign it's raising the stakes in a final play to wrest control from its Russian partners, or is it folding its hand for good? TNK-BP is now viewed in the market as one of BP’s principal risk factors. But if Bob Dudley is trying to extract concessions, he should remember that in Russia they favor a different and much more dangerous game of chance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 4 Comments
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI -11.5%) falls hard after its bottom-line results and guidance disappoint the...

    OmniVision (OVTI -11.5%) falls hard after its bottom-line results and guidance disappoint the Street in spite of healthy top-line figures, thanks to inventory-driven gross margin weakness. During its earnings call, OmniVision suggested yield issues and high production costs for its high-end BSI-2 image sensors are also affecting margins. While expecting margins to remain under pressure, Needham remains positive on account of OmniVision's BSI-2 ramp and expected iPhone orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • LDOS

    Shares of SAIC (SAI +1.9%) trade higher after the firm beats earnings estimates with its Q1...

    Shares of SAIC (SAI +1.9%) trade higher after the firm beats earnings estimates with its Q1 report and back up its previously-issued FY13 guidance numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • GOLD

    Gold mining names show early strength, as gold futures gain nearly $40/oz. following weak jobs...

    Gold mining names show early strength, as gold futures gain nearly $40/oz. following weak jobs data: ABX +4.8%, AUY +5%, IAG +6.2%, NEM +5.3%, GFI +3.4%, GOLD +5.1%. For today at least, gold resumes its safe-haven status: Comex gold +2.4% to $1601.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 6 Comments
  • T

    It's "virtually impossible" to suggest Leap Wireless' (LEAP -8.8%) deal to carry the iPhone has...

    It's "virtually impossible" to suggest Leap Wireless' (LEAP -8.8%) deal to carry the iPhone has a positive risk/reward for the carrier, says Canaccord's Greg Willer, given Leap is selling the phone with limited subsidies, and few details are known about the deal's terms. Moreover, though Leap trades at just 3.9x estimated 2013 EBITDA, Miller argues this valuation is comparable to those of other companies "whose future is in doubt."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -3.5%) announces a "significant" new discovery in the Hogshooter play in the...

    Chesapeake (CHK -3.5%) announces a "significant" new discovery in the Hogshooter play in the Anadarko Basin of the Texas Panhandle and western Oklahoma. Chesapeake owns ~30K net acres in the play, which are more than 90% held by production from its legacy deeper Granite Wash production.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • CLX

    Clorox (NYSE:CLX) CEO Don Knauss says the company will be aggressive in adding properties to its...

    Clorox (NYSE:CLX) CEO Don Knauss says the company will be aggressive in adding properties to its healthcare portfolio over the next five years. He notes that a particular focus could be companies offering disinfection products. CLX +0.4% premarket in defiance of a broad market selloff.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • PLUS

    EPlus (NASDAQ:PLUS) -3.4% premarket after announcing it will restate several previous quarterly...

    EPlus (NASDAQ:PLUS) -3.4% premarket after announcing it will restate several previous quarterly and annual financial statements after finding two unrelated errors in its reports.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • MOD

    Modine Manufacturing (NYSE:MOD): FQ4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $388.7M (-2% Y/Y)...

    Modine Manufacturing (NYSE:MOD): FQ4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $388.7M (-2% Y/Y) misses by $18M. Shares -8.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • VRA

    Shares of Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) move up 7.1% premarket after the firm beats consensus...

    Shares of Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) move up 7.1% premarket after the firm beats consensus earnings estimates with its Q1 report and reaffirms its guidance for FY12. The company was able to offset higher cotton and labor costs during the period by boosting sales 34% Y/Y at its own stores and 26% via its online channel.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 AM

  • EU shares fall further after economic data provides continued woe, whether it PMI (I, II) or...

    EU shares fall further after economic data provides continued woe, whether it PMI (I, II) or unemployment (I, II). Euro STOXX 50 -1%, London -0.2%, Paris -1.2%, Frankfurt -1.5%, Madrid -0.3%, Milan -0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 AM | 1 Comment
